devanagari:
रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय
प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः।
प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु
श्रुतिः एव अकारणम्॥ ८ ॥
transliteration:
raso'ham apsu kaunteya
prabhāsmī śaśi-sūryayoḥ
praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣu
śrutiḥ eva akāraṇam
translation: I am the taste of water, O son of Kunti; I am the light of the sun and the moon. I am the sacred syllable Om in all the Vedas. I am the sound in ether and the ability in man.
purport: In this verse, Lord Krishna reveals various aspects of His divine presence in the world. He identifies Himself with the taste of water, the light of the sun and moon, and the sacred syllable Om, emphasizing His omnipresence. By associating Himself with these fundamental elements, Krishna illustrates how He is the essence of all that exists. This understanding helps devotees recognize the divine in everyday experiences. The mention of Om signifies the ultimate sound that represents the Supreme Reality, further establishing Krishna's connection to the Vedas and spiritual knowledge. This verse encourages individuals to see the divine in all aspects of life, fostering a deeper appreciation for the presence of Krishna in the world around them.
